meanings.definition: A fastening made by tying a piece of string, rope, or something similar
meanings.sent1: She secured the tent with tight knots.
meanings.sent2: He learned to tie knots during his camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tied knots in the shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was as strong as the knots in the rope.
meanings.sent5: The sailor's expertise in tying knots saved the day.

meanings.definition: A tangled mass in hair or thread
meanings.sent1: Her hair was full of knots after the windy walk.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur had so many knots that it needed grooming.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of knots from his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The mystery writer unraveled the knots of the plot one by one.
meanings.sent5: The old necklace had a knot of pearls at its center.

meanings.definition: A unit of speed equal to one nautical mile per hour
meanings.sent1: The boat was cruising at ten knots per hour.
meanings.sent2: The ship's speed was measured in knots.
meanings.sent3: The race car zoomed past at incredible knots.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by at a hundred knots.
meanings.sent5: The wind pushed the sailboat forward at five knots.
